body:
Malaria control may progress more rapidly in some parts of a country than in others, and the strategies for surveillance will vary. For example, some districts may report only aggregated cases, while others may add details of individual cases. Some parts of the country may be pursuing elimination and must identify the origin of each case in order to intensify control measures in specific localities and ensure that transmission is halted at the earliest possibly opportunity.

The information collected must be used to improve the impact of the programme. Two major uses of this information are for planning programmes and for monitoring and evaluating them.
title: Introduction
